item.title: Finite simple groups have many classes of $p$-elements
item.description: arXiv:2411.18863v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: For an element $x$ of a finite group $T$, the $\mathrm{Aut}(T)$-class of $x$ is the set $\{ x^\sigma\mid \sigma\in \mathrm{Aut}(T)\}$. We prove that the order $|T|$ of a finite nonabelian simple group $T$ is bounded above by a function of the parameter $m(T)$, where $m(T)$ is the maximum, over all primes $p$, of the number of $\mathrm{Aut}(T)$-classes of elements of $T$ of $p$-power order. This bound is a substantial generalisation of results of Pyber, and of H\'ethelyi and K\"ulshammer, and it has implications for relative Brauer groups of finite extensions of global fields.
item.dc:creator: Michael Giudici, Luke Morgan, Cheryl E. Praeger

item.title: Short character values on large conjugacy classes
item.description: arXiv:2411.19283v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We provide an example of a finite group with a conjugacy class of average size on which fewer than half of the irreducible characters are either zero or a root of unity.
item.dc:creator: Alexander R. Miller

item.title: Geometric invariants for $p$-groups of class 2 and exponent $p$
item.description: arXiv:2411.19555v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce geometric invariants for $p$-groups of class $2$ and exponent $p$. We report on their effectiveness in distinguishing among 5-generator $p$-groups of this type.
item.dc:creator: E. A. O'Brien, Mima Stanojkovski

item.title: Infinite volume ends of quotient graphs and homogeneous spaces
item.description: arXiv:2411.19776v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce the space of infinite volume ends of a locally compact second countable (lcsc) space that admits a Radon measure. In certain cases, this coincides with the classical space of ends. Consider a discrete subgroup $\Gamma$ of a unimodular lcsc group $G$ that is not coamenable. Assume that $G$ has property (T) and the associated homogeneous space $G/\Gamma$ is equipped with the Haar measure. We demonstrate that if $G$ is path connected, then $G/\Gamma$ has exactly one infinite volume end. In a related vein, if $G$ acts transitively on a locally finite connected graph $X$ with compact open vertex stabilizers and the action of the subgroup $\Gamma$ is free, we show that $X/\Gamma$ has exactly one end. We also obtain identical results for certain discrete subgroups $\Gamma$ of nonamenable product groups $G$. These results can be applied to understand ends of Schreier graphs and infinite volume ends of quotients of symmetric spaces of noncompact type.
item.dc:creator: Konrad Wr\'obel

item.title: The connectivity of the normalising and permuting graph of a finite soluble group
item.description: arXiv:2411.19837v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce the normalising graph of a group and study the connectivity of the normalising and permuting graphs of a group when the group is finite and soluble. In particular, we classify finite soluble groups with disconnected normalising graph. The main results shows that if a finite soluble group has connected normalising graph then this graph has diameter at most 6. Furthermore, this bound is tight. A corollary then presents the connectivity properties of the permuting graph.
item.dc:creator: Eoghan Farrell, Chris Parker

item.title: Quasitoric representation of generalized braids
item.description: arXiv:2411.18783v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper, we define generalized braid theories in alignment with the language of Fenn and Bartholomew for knot theories, and compute a generating set for the pure generalized braid theories. Using this, we prove that every oriented normal generalized knot is the closure of a quasitoric normal generalized braid. Further, we prove that the set of quasitoric normal generalized braids forms a subgroup of normal generalized braid group.
item.dc:creator: Neha Nanda, Manpreet Singh

item.title: Dynamic asymptotic dimension growth for group actions and groupoids
item.description: arXiv:2411.19712v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We introduce the notion of dynamic asymptotic dimension growth for actions of discrete groups on compact spaces, and more generally for locally compact \'etale groupoids with compact unit space. Using the work of Bartels, L\"uck, and Reich to bridge our notion for group actions with asymptotic dimension growth for groups, thus providing many concrete examples for our notion. Moreover, we show that the asymptotic dimension growth for a discrete metric space of bounded geometry is equivalent to the dynamic asymptotic dimension growth for its associated coarse groupoid, hence deducing that the coarse groupoid with subexponential dynamic asymptotic dimension growth is amenable. More generally, every $\sigma$-compact locally compact Hausdorff \'etale groupoid with compact unit space having dynamic asymptotic dimension growth at most $x^{\alpha}$ $(0<\alpha<1)$ is amenable.
item.dc:creator: Hang Wang, Yanru Wang, Jianguo Zhang, Dapeng Zhou

item.title: On stable equivalences with endopermutation source and K\"ulshammer--Puig classes
item.description: arXiv:2411.19739v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We give a new proof, by using the terminology and notation in the textbook \cite{Lin18b}, to a result, due to Puig, stating that a stable equivalence of Morita type between two block algebras of finite groups induced by a bimodule with an endopermutation source preserves K\"ulshammer--Puig classes.
item.dc:creator: Xin Huang

item.title: Totally elliptic surface group representations
item.description: arXiv:2411.19748v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We characterize all totally elliptic surface group representations into $\mathrm{PSL}_2\mathbb{R}$ by showing that they are either representations into a compact subgroup or Deroin--Tholozan representations.
item.dc:creator: Arnaud Maret

item.title: Fundamental regions for non-isometric group actions
item.description: arXiv:2112.11082v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We generalise results about isometric group actions on metric spaces and their fundamental regions to the context of merely continuous group actions. In particular, we obtain results that yield the relative compactness of a fundamental region for a cocompact group action. As a consequence, we obtain a criterion for a cocompact cyclic group of semi-Riemannian homotheties to be inessential.
item.arxiv:journal_reference: Geom. Dedicata 218 (2024), no. 5, Paper No. 95, 13 pp
item.dc:creator: Thomas Leistner, Stuart Teisseire

item.title: Regularity of quasigeodesics characterises hyperbolicity
item.description: arXiv:2205.08573v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We characterise hyperbolic groups in terms of quasigeodesics in the Cayley graph forming regular languages. We also obtain a quantitative characterisation of hyperbolicity of geodesic metric spaces by the non-existence of certain local (3,0)-quasigeodesic loops. As an application we make progress towards a question of Shapiro regarding groups admitting a uniquely geodesic Cayley graph.
item.dc:creator: Sam Hughes, Patrick S. Nairne, Davide Spriano

item.title: $\mathrm{SL}_2$-character varieties of $2$-generated groups and failure of weak integrality
item.description: arXiv:2410.23233v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Let $\ell$ be a prime number, $k$ a positive integer and consider the group $\Gamma_{\ell^k} :=\langle a,b\ \vert\ a^{\ell^k(\ell^k-1)}ba^{-\ell^k}b^{-2}\rangle$. We prove that $\Gamma_{\ell^k}$ is not $\mathrm{SL}_2$-weakly integral with obstruction at exactly the prime $\ell$. We also give a general description of the character varieties of $2$-generated groups with a relation of the form $a^{n_1} b^{m_1} a^{n_2} b^{m_2} = 1$.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Church, Francisco Garc\'ia-Cort\'es
